title: –†–∞–±–æ—á–∏–µ Heidelberg Materials —É–≥—Ä–æ–∂–∞—é—Ç "—Ä–∞–∑—Ä—É—à–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π" –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–æ–π –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤—É –±–µ—Ç–æ–Ω–∞
title_en: Heidelberg Materials workers threaten "devastating" concrete strike
summary_en:
The impending strike by one of the largest concrete producers in the lower mainland is affecting the region's construction sector.
The union representing Heidelberg Materials workers has issued a statement claiming that if negotiations fail, it will lead to a strike.
One of the construction specialists fears that the strike could lead to significant disruptions in work and affect small and medium-sized builders.
Heidelberg Materials is responsible for supplying about 33% of the concrete in the lower Mainland, which can lead to an abrupt halt in construction.
A prolonged strike of any kind can have long-term consequences and lead to job losses.
Provincial authorities called the work a key factor in accelerating the completion of the Broadway subway project by 2027.

title: ASSA –ø–µ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É –≤ Aeromexico –Ω–∞ 1 –∏—é–ª—è
title_en: ASSA reschedules strike at Aeromexico on July 1
summary_en:
The Association of Air Carrier Trade Unions (ASSA) postponed the strike at Aeromexico for the first minute on July 1.
Secretary General Ada Salazar announced the acceptance of the airline's proposal, which involves an increase in wages by 4.65 percent and benefits by 3.93 percent.
The agreement will be the subject of consultations with 3,120 ASSA licensees in the coming weeks.
If approved by at least 51 percent of the participants, the strike will be postponed until the first minute on July 1.
The Mexican airline proposed a global increase of 8.58 percent, which was accepted two days before the end of the strike.
The agreement provides for a 48-hour break on long-haul flights to Europe and Asia.
The airline's suggestion that its overtime workers "sell their vacation" also remains.
Similarly, it was decided to terminate the Covid Control Agreement signed during the pandemic in 2020.
The interviewed workers considered the vote "illegal" because, in addition, "there were comrades to whom the doors of the trade union were closed."

title: –û—Ñ–∏—Ü–µ—Ä—ã –ø–æ–≥—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –≤–æ–π—Å–∫ –≤ –•–∏—Ç—Ä–æ—É –∑–∞–≤—Ç—Ä–∞ –æ–±—ä—è–≤—è—Ç —Ç—Ä–µ—Ö–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω—É—é –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É
title_en: Border Force officers at Heathrow will go on a three-day strike tomorrow
summary_en:
More than 500 border guards at Heathrow Airport have declared a three-day strike.
The strike was caused by disagreements over employee lists and the introduction of new rosters.
The PCS union said that more than 250 employees could lose their jobs or be transferred to another job against their will.
The remaining employees will have longer shifts, inflexible shift rules and a lack of clarity in the design of vacations.
A petition was launched in support of the workers.
The PCS General Secretary calls on trade unionists and the public to support the petition and ask the leadership of the border troops to abandon the undesirable and inoperable list.
PCS repeatedly called for more flexibility in the new line-up, but the management refused to listen.

title: Telmex –∏ Aeromexico –ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Ç–≤—Ä–∞—â–∞—é—Ç –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –ø–æ–≤—ã—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∑–∞—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–æ–π –ø–ª–∞—Ç—ã
title_en: Telmex and Aeromexico prevent strikes of their workers due to wage increases
summary_en:
Telmex and Aeromexico are preventing workers from striking over wage increases.
The unions will vote for a 6.1% increase for telecom operators and a 4.6% increase for aviation fees.
The employer of telephone operators has agreed to increase wages by 6.1%, and airfare allowances have increased by 4.6%.
Employees will have to vote on whether they approve of the agreements concluded with the companies.
The threat of a mass strike loomed over Mexico's largest telephone company.
The Union of Telephone Operators of the Mexican Republic has called for a 12% increase in their wages.
The signing of the agreement led to such achievements as recruitment of vacancies, renewal of the company's fleet and a bonus for employees.
Employees will have to approve the measures during a vote to be held on June 13-14.
The Air Carriers Trade Union Association has promised a national strike by June 1 next year.
